captions.text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

I have been reading the classic fantasy series
The Chronicles of Narnia

this winter. And if you can’t tell, my outfit
is inspired by the White Witch.

So, today we are going to be making some treats
from the story, they also happen

to be some of my favorite winter treats, Turkish
Delights!

But don’t tell Aslan because, he’s like,
kind of a party pooper.

OH! Uh, hey Aslan! No, we’re not, we’re
not making treats over here of

trickery and tomfoolery and trying to take
over the kingdom…

Don’t worry about it, hey go over there
in the other side of the wardrobe!
‘Dere you go, ah!
OK, let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 3 cups
of regular sugar, a bowl of

powdered sugar, you don’t need a certain
amount, because we’re gonna use this

to decorate, so just a bowl of powdered sugar.
1/2 a cup of cran-raspberry juice

red food coloring dye, 3/4 cup of corn starch,
3 tablespoons of light corn syrup,

1 tablespoon of vanilla extract, 3 packets
of unflavored gelatin. And then

we’re gonna need 2 different measurements
of water, the 1st measurement is

1/2 a cup, the 2nd measurement is 1 and 1/2
cups, and a big saucepan with a

candy thermometer. And then last but not least
we’ll need a pan, I’m using a

square pan and it is 8 inches by 8 inches,
and then I’ve lined it with a piece
of cling wrap.
Let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do, is
we’re gonna make 2 mixtures that we’re
gonna set aside for later.

The 1st one, you’re gonna take your cran-raspberry
juice and we’re gonna pour in

the 3 packets of gelatin, you’re just gonna
pour them on the top and let them
sit, you don’t need to mix.

The 2nd thing we’re gonna mix together,
we’re gonna mix our cornstarch, then

you’re gonna add 1/2 a cup of water, then
you’re gonna whisk it together until

it’s really smooth and pasty, once this
is mixed together we’re gonna set it

off to the side and we’re gonna grab our
medium sized saucepan and we’re gonna
make some sugar syrup.

In your saucepan we are going to combine all
our sugar…
Oooooooooooh!!!!!

And the 1 and 1/2 cup of water, and your light
corn syrup, it’s pretty gooey!

Now we’re gonna whisk it all together, like
this!
Now we’re gonna bring this over to the stove.

Stir your mixture on a medium heat until it
reaches 240 degrees.

Once it’s reached 240 degrees, add in your
corn starch mixture, and whisk
together on a medium/low heat until it thickens.

Once its thickened, you’re gonna take your
syrup mixture off of the stove and

we’re gonna add our juice and gelatin mixture,
so just scoop it in there, I’m

just using a little spoon. And we’re gonna
add our vanilla extract.

Now we’re gonna mix it together until it’s
nice and smooth, it does take a little
while, but not too long.

Once everything’s dissolved, we’re gonna
add 3 drops of red food coloring.
And then mix it together!

Once everything is mixed together we’re
gonna pour everything into our tray,

but 1st we’re gonna sprinkle a little powdered
sugar at the bottom, pour it in.

Now that we’ve got it poured into our container,
now I’m just gonna take a

spoon, and we’re gonna scoop off the bubbles
on top, and just put ‘em back
in the pot.

Now for the easy part, you’re gonna let
these sit out for 5 hours to set.

I like to let them sit overnight, you want
to let them sit at room temperature,

don’t put them in the refrigerator, just
let them sit out at room temperature.

You can cover them if you like. It’s a good
time to also, maybe watch some movies if

you’ve got some time to kill. Maybe some
Chronicles of Narnia?

Now that the turkish delights have set, we’re
gonna take them out of the tray

and we’re gonna cut them into little yummy
candy bites!
And roll them in powdered sugar!

So the 1st thing that you’re gonna do
on a cutting board, is take

a little bit of powdered sugar, put it down
on the surface.
Pffft! Pfffft! A-ha-ha-ha!
Now, we’re gonna flip ‘em upside down!

Then we’re gonna gently peel off the cling
wrap.

Now we’re gonna cut some squares, I’ve
got a little pizza cutter, and I’ve just
put some powdered sugar along the top.

Just remember, the Turkish Delights are very
tacky, they’re very sticky, so

you might even want to put a little powdered
sugar on your pizza cutter.
A-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!
Look at that!

What you want to do is cut strips, just like
this, all the way down,

and then we’re gonna cut them into little
squares.

Now that we’ve got our Turkish Delights
cut, we’re gonna roll each
little piece in powdered sugar

And I better, I better taste one, just to
make sure they’re good!
Mmmmmmm!

Now you’re gonna do this for the rest of
your delights!
Ta-da!

Here are The Chronicles of Narnia Turkish
Delights!

I hope you guys liked them, they were really
fun to make.

I will be posting lots of pictures on my Facebook,
Instagram, Tumblr and Twitter.

And if you guys make these, please send me
a photo, I love seeing your baking
creations, I get a big kick out of it!

And, if you guys have any other ideas for
any other Nerdy Nummies, please let

me know, leave me a comment down below and
I will do my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!
You want a treat? You want a treat?
Yeah? Yeah, I know you did.
White Witch and Aslan are biffles!
#PlotTwist

Have you ever laughed so hard that boogers came
out of your nose like this?
I have!
